tool.name: CollectRnaSeqMetrics
tool.description: collect metrics about the alignment of RNA to various functional classes of loci in the genome
tool.command:
## Set up input files
## Reference sequences
#set $reference_fasta_filename = "localref.fa"
#if str( $reference_source.reference_source_selector ) == "history": ln -s "${reference_source.ref_file}" "${reference_fasta_filename}" && #else: #set $reference_fasta_filename = str( $reference_source.ref_file.fields.path ) #end if
## refFlat data
grep -v '^#' ${refFlat} | awk '{print $11"\t"$1"\t"$2"\t"$3"\t"$4"\t"$5"\t"$6"\t"$7"\t"$8"\t"$9"\t"$10}' > refFlat.tab &&
## Start picard command
@java_options@ java -jar \$JAVA_JAR_PATH/CollectRnaSeqMetrics.jar REF_FLAT=refFlat.tab
#if str( $ribosomal_intervals ) != "None": RIBOSOMAL_INTERVALS="${ribosomal_intervals}" #end if
STRAND_SPECIFICITY="${strand_specificity}" MINIMUM_LENGTH="${minimum_length}" CHART_OUTPUT="${pdfFile}"
#for $sequence_to_ignore in $ignore_list: IGNORE_SEQUENCE="${sequence_to_ignore.sequence}" #end for
RRNA_FRAGMENT_PERCENTAGE="${rrna_fragment_percentage}" METRIC_ACCUMULATION_LEVEL="${metric_accumulation_level}" INPUT="${inputFile}" OUTPUT="${outFile}" REFERENCE_SEQUENCE="${reference_fasta_filename}" ASSUME_SORTED="${assume_sorted}"
QUIET=true VERBOSITY=ERROR VALIDATION_STRINGENCY=${validation_stringency}

validator.message: A built-in reference genome is not available for the build associated with the selected input file

param.name: ref_file
param.label: Use the folloing dataset as the reference sequence
param.help: REFERENCE_SEQUENCE; You can upload a FASTA sequence to the history and use it as reference

param.name: refFlat
param.label: Gene annotations in refFlat form
param.help: See help below on how to obtain refFlat data

param.name: ribosomal_intervals
param.label: Location of rRNA sequences in genome, in interval_list format.
param.help: RIBOSOMAL_INTERVALS; If not specified no bases will be identified as being ribosomal.

param.name: strand_specificity
param.label: What is the RNA-seq library strand specificity
param.help: STRAND_SPECIFICITY; For unpaired reads, use FIRST_READ_TRANSCRIPTION_STRAND if the reads are expected to be on the transcription strand.

param.name: minimum_length
param.label: When calculating coverage based values use only use transcripts of this length or greater

repeat.name: ignore_list
repeat.title: Sequences to ignore
repeat.help: You can provide multiple sequences by clicking the button below

param.name: rrna_fragment_percentage
param.label: This percentage of the length of a fragment must overlap one of the ribosomal intervals for a read or read pair to be considered rRNA.

param.name: metric_accumulation_level
param.label: The level(s) at which to accumulate metrics

param.name: assume_sorted
param.label: Assume the input file is already sorted
